pageContext.claim: “So interesting to see the Mayor of Oakland and other Sanctuary Cities NOT WANT our currently 'detained immigrants' after release due to the ridiculous court ordered 20 day rule. If they don't want to serve our Nation by taking care of them, why should other cities & towns?”
pageContext.analysis: In an interview on NPR the morning of Trump's evening tweet, Oakland Mayor Libby Schaaf said the opposite of Trump's claim when asked if the city would accept migrants: "Yes. Oakland welcomes all people. My job as a mayor is to welcome people. I don't build walls. It's our job to welcome everyone into our city, ensure their safety, ensure that their families can thrive. And that is my job no matter where those people came from or how they got there." She added: "We know that data proves that undocumented or documented immigrants commit far fewer crimes. So not only is our community richer and more loving. But it also is safer because we are a sanctuary city and a diverse city."
